intro: Corydalis yazgulemica, commonly known as the Yazgulem corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces elongated seed pods that contain small, dark seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
